elements.title: Long-term impact and biological recovery in a deep-sea mining track (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Long-term impact and biological recovery in a deep-sea mining track

  • Daniel O. B. Jones
  • Maria Belen Arias
  • Adrian G. Glover
Article26 Mar 2025

elements.title: Phosphate-enabled mechanochemical PFAS destruction for fluoride reuse (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Phosphate-enabled mechanochemical PFAS destruction for fluoride reuse

This study highlights a protocol that converts various perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFASs), including fluoroplastics, into valuable fluorochemicals through a solvent-free mechanochemical process, thereby enabling fluorine recovery and contributing to a sustainable circular fluorine economy.

  • Long Yang
  • Zijun Chen
  • Vronique Gouverneur
ArticleOpen Access26 Mar 2025

elements.title: Solidification of Earths mantle led inevitably to a basal magma ocean (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Solidification of Earths mantle led inevitably to a basal magma ocean

As the early Earth solidified, gravitational segregation of dense, iron-rich melts drove mantle evolution, injecting geochemical signatures of shallow silicate fractionation into the deep mantle and inevitably forming a basal magma ocean.

  • Charles-douard Boukar
  • James Badro
  • Henri Samuel
ArticleOpen Access26 Mar 2025

elements.title: BRCA2 prevents PARPi-mediated PARP1 retention to protect RAD51 filaments (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
BRCA2 prevents PARPi-mediated PARP1 retention to protect RAD51 filaments

The tumour-suppressor protein BRCA2 is discovered to have a previously undescribed role in maintaining genomic integrity and the sensitivity of PARP1 inhibitors.

  • Sudipta Lahiri
  • George Hamilton
  • Eli Rothenberg
Article26 Mar 2025

elements.title: Glutamate gating of AMPA-subtype iGluRs at physiological temperatures (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Glutamate gating of AMPA-subtype iGluRs at physiological temperatures

Physiological temperatures augment activation of glutamate receptors, which enables the structural basis of neuronal excitation to be elucidated.

  • Anish Kumar Mondal
  • Elisa Carrillo
  • Edward C. Twomey
ArticleOpen Access26 Mar 2025

elements.title: Oxidation of retromer complex controls mitochondrial translation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Oxidation of retromer complex controls mitochondrial translation

Systematic base-editing and computational screens identify specific cysteine residues on VPS35 in the retromer complex as key sensors that decrease mitochondrial translation in response to reactive oxygen species signals.

  • Junbing Zhang
  • Md Yousuf Ali
  • Liron Bar-Peled
Article26 Mar 2025

elements.title: The contribution of de novo coding mutations to meningomyelocele (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The contribution of de novo coding mutations to meningomyelocele

Exome sequencing of 851 trios from more than 2,500 individuals finds 187 genes with de novo mutations that contribute to meningomyelocele (spina bifida) and highlights critical pathways required for neural tube closure.

  • Yoo-Jin Jiny Ha
  • Ashna Nisal
  • Joseph G. Gleeson
Article26 Mar 2025

elements.title: Gene-modified pig-to-human liver xenotransplantation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Gene-modified pig-to-human liver xenotransplantation

A gene-edited pig liver transplanted into a human recipient remains functional after 10days and indicates that porcine organs could help meet the growing demand for liver transplants.

  • Kai-Shan Tao
  • Zhao-Xu Yang
  • Ke-Feng Dou
ArticleOpen Access26 Mar 2025

elements.title: Deconstruction of rubber via CH amination and aza-Cope rearrangement (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Deconstruction of rubber via CH amination and aza-Cope rearrangement

Deconstruction of rubber is achieved using CH amination and aza-Cope rearrangement to provide precursors for epoxy resins.

  • Sydney E. Towell
  • Maxim Ratushnyy
  • Aleksandr V. Zhukhovitskiy
Article26 Mar 2025

elements.title: irCLIP-RNP and Re-CLIP reveal patterns of dynamic protein assemblies on RNA (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
irCLIP-RNP and Re-CLIP reveal patterns of dynamic protein assemblies on RNA

EGF-induced recruitment of UPF1 adjacent to HNRNPC induces splicing surveillance of cell proliferation mRNAs.

  • Luca Ducoli
  • Brian J. Zarnegar
  • Paul A. Khavari
Article26 Mar 2025

elements.title: A broad-spectrum lasso peptide antibiotic targeting the bacterial ribosome (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A broad-spectrum lasso peptide antibiotic targeting the bacterial ribosome

A new lasso peptide antibiotic exhibits broad-spectrum activity against Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria by interfering with bacterial protein synthesis, is unaffected by common resistance mechanisms and shows no toxicity towards human cells.

  • Manoj Jangra
  • Dmitrii Y. Travin
  • Gerard D. Wright
Article26 Mar 2025

elements.title: Synaptic and neural behaviours in a standard silicon transistor (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Synaptic and neural behaviours in a standard silicon transistor

A standard commercial CMOS FET can exhibit synaptic-like long-term potentiation and depression or neuron-like leaky-integrate-and-fire and adaptive frequency-bursting behaviour when biased in a specific but unconventional way.

  • Sebastian Pazos
  • Kaichen Zhu
  • Mario Lanza
ArticleOpen Access26 Mar 2025

elements.title: Catalytic allylation of native hexoses and pentoses in water with indium (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Catalytic allylation of native hexoses and pentoses in water with indium

A longstanding challenge in organic synthesisthe catalytic allylation of unprotected saccharides in an aqueous medium, a key step for the synthesis of Millad NX 8000is achieved through a simple and efficient indium-catalysed nucleophilic allylation using a three-carbon-unit allylboronic acid or its pinacol ester.

  • Tapas Adak
  • Travis Menard
  • Scott E. Denmark
Article26 Mar 2025

elements.title: Plasticity of the mammalian integrated stress response (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Plasticity of the mammalian integrated stress response

A study describes the split integrated stress response, a cellular stress response mechanism characterized by reduced eIF2B activity without eIF2 phosphorylation, which activates the eIF4EATF4PCK2 axis, enabling metabolic reprogramming.

  • Chien-Wen Chen
  • David Papadopoli
  • Maria Hatzoglou
ArticleOpen Access26 Mar 2025

elements.title: A coronavirus assembly inhibitor that targets the viral membrane protein (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A coronavirus assembly inhibitor that targets the viral membrane protein

High-throughput screening and hit optimization have led to the development of a small molecule, CIM-834, that targets the SARS-CoV-2 membrane protein and blocks assembly of the virus.

  • Manon Laporte
  • Dirk Jochmans
  • Johan Neyts
ArticleOpen Access26 Mar 2025

elements.title: Macrophages harness hepatocyte glutamate to boost liver regeneration (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Macrophages harness hepatocyte glutamate to boost liver regeneration

Glutamate metabolically reprograms bone-marrow-derived macrophages, stabilizing HIF1, which transcriptionally activates WNT3 to promote YAP1-dependent hepatocyte proliferation, boosting liver regeneration.

  • Mara del Mar Rigual
  • Mariana Angulo-Aguado
  • Nabil Djouder
Article26 Mar 2025

elements.title: The P-loop NTPase RUVBL2 is a conserved clock component across eukaryotes (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The P-loop NTPase RUVBL2 is a conserved clock component across eukaryotes

A study finds that RUVBL2 is a conserved component of eukaryotic circadian clocks and suggests that slow ATPase activity, which was initially discovered in cyanobacteria, is a shared feature of eukaryotic clocks.

  • Meimei Liao
  • Yanqin Liu
  • Eric Erquan Zhang
Article26 Mar 2025

elements.title: The global human impact on biodiversity (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The global human impact on biodiversity

Key measures of biodiversity were quantified and found to be affected by human pressures that shifted community composition and decreased local diversity across terrestrial, freshwater and marine ecosystems.

  • Franois Keck
  • Tianna Peller
  • Florian Altermatt
ArticleOpen Access26 Mar 2025

elements.title: A human brain map of mitochondrial respiratory capacity and diversity (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A human brain map of mitochondrial respiratory capacity and diversity

The ability to physically partition the human brain at a spatial resolution comparable to neuroimaging methods enabled the development of a brain-wide atlas of mitochondrial content, specialization and enzymatic oxidation and phosphorylation activities.

  • Eugene V. Mosharov
  • Ayelet M. Rosenberg
  • Martin Picard
Article26 Mar 2025

elements.title: Genome-wide CRISPR screen in human T cells reveals regulators of FOXP3 (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Genome-wide CRISPR screen in human T cells reveals regulators of FOXP3

The RBPJNCOR repressor complex is identified as a negative regulator of FOXP3 expression through modulation of histone acetylation in induced regulatory T cells.

  • Kelvin Y. Chen
  • Tatsuya Kibayashi
  • Shimon Sakaguchi
Article26 Mar 2025
